column4: My video applications are screwed up. I can watch Flash movies in Firefox (using flash-restricted), but when I try to watch movies in Totem (or VLC even) the picture is drawn as a bunch of vertical lines. Interestingly, this still happens when I use a LiveCD. How do I fix that?
what type of graphic card do you have ?
I have an ATI 400 M card.
I'm using fglrx, dunno if that's supported.
I dont use ati cards , but afaik support for them is not great atm altho it is improving ?
Video has worked on this card since I first installed Edgy.
what are you using to play ?
I can play flash videos using Firefox (and flash-restricted), but not any kind of videos using Totem or VLC.
I can't play Ogg Theora, AVI, mpg, anything.
have you tried reinstalling totem / gstreamer packages ?
I have not tried reinstalling gstreamer or totem. How do I do that?
openup synaptic and search for gstreamer and reinstall the installed , Have you installed the codecs for the media you are trying to play ?
Yes, the codecs are installed and have been working for a year and half now.
I would try re-install the gst/totem first , have you run totem from the cli ( any output ? )
Nope, good idea though.
I reinstalled all of my gstreamer packages, including all the codecs, and the problem still persists.
any output from cli ?
Nope, no CLI output.
run gstreamer-properties
I ran gstreamer-properties, and the video output is set to "Default". The "Test" button shows a video of colourful stripes with static in the corner.
are you sure the source is not poluted and you have the correct codec
Yup, these are all movies that I have played before.
so plugin is set to autodetect in gst-prop, find it strange it just stoped working , did you install some new sw ?
